defaultSubAgentId.description: ID of the default sub-agent that handles initial user messages. Required at runtime but nullable on creation to avoid circular FK dependency. Workflow: 1) POST Agent (without defaultSubAgentId), 2) POST SubAgent, 3) PATCH Agent with defaultSubAgentId.

transferCountIs.description: The maximum number of transfers to trigger the stop condition.

defaultSubAgentId.description: ID of the default sub-agent that handles initial user messages. Required at runtime but nullable on creation to avoid circular FK dependency. Workflow: 1) POST Agent (without defaultSubAgentId), 2) POST SubAgent, 3) PATCH Agent with defaultSubAgentId.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence

manageDb.description: Whether the manage database is reachable

hash.description: The commit hash this ref resolves to

name.description: The name of the ref (branch name, tag name, or commit hash)

key.description: Key name for the signature (header name, query param, or JMESPath)

prefix.description: Optional prefix to strip from signature value (e.g., "sha256=", "v0=")

regex.description: Optional regex pattern to extract signature from value (first capture group used)

source.description: Location of the signature in the incoming request

allowEmptyBody.description: If true, allow empty request body for verification

headerCaseSensitive.description: If true, header names are matched case-sensitively

normalizeUnicode.description: If true, normalize Unicode strings to NFC form before signing

algorithm.description: HMAC algorithm to use for signature verification

encoding.description: Encoding format of the signature (hex or base64)

signedComponents.description: Array of components that are signed (order matters)

key.description: Key for header name or JMESPath expression (required for header/body sources)

regex.description: Optional regex pattern to extract from component value (first capture group)

required.description: If false, missing component results in empty string instead of error

source.description: Source of the component: header value, body via JMESPath, or literal string

value.description: Literal string value (required for literal source)

stepCountIs.description: The maximum number of steps to trigger the stop condition.

transferCountIs.description: The maximum number of transfers to trigger the stop condition.

bearerAuth.description: Bearer token authentication. Use this for API clients and service-to-service communication. Set the Authorization header to "Bearer <token>".

cookieAuth.description: Session-based authentication using HTTP-only cookies. Cookies are automatically sent by browsers. For server-side requests, include cookies with names starting with "better-auth." in the Cookie header.
cookieAuth.name: better-auth.session_token

info.description: REST API for the Inkeep Agent Framework.
info.title: Inkeep Agents API

get.description: Keeps the workflow worker active to process queued jobs (called by cron)

post.summary: Trigger evaluation on a single conversation
Trigger evaluations on conversations with specified evaluators

post.description: Filters conversations based on job filters, creates an evaluation run, and enqueues workflows
post.summary: Trigger evaluations on conversations by evaluation job config

post.description: Runs dataset items for processing through the chat API

get.description: Check if the management service is healthy
Get the current authenticated user and their organization for CLI usage
List all agents the user can invoke. Requires a valid JWT token.

401.description: Unauthorized - invalid or missing JWT token

get.description: Get information about optional server-side capabilities and configuration.
Handles OAuth authorization codes for MCP tools and completes the authentication flow

302.description: Redirect to frontend after successful OAuth

get.description: Detects OAuth requirements and redirects to authorization server (public endpoint)

400.description: OAuth not supported or configuration error

get.summary: Initiate OAuth login for MCP tool

get.description: Generates a URL to install the GitHub App on an organization or user account. The URL includes a signed state parameter that encodes the tenant ID and expires after 10 minutes. After installation, GitHub will redirect back to our callback endpoint with this state.

url.description: GitHub App installation URL with signed state parameter

200.description: GitHub App installation URL generated successfully

get.description: Returns a list of GitHub App installations connected to this tenant. By default, deleted installations are filtered out. Use the includeDisconnected query parameter to include them.

parameters.description: Include disconnected installations in the response
parameters.name: includeDisconnected

schema.description: Include disconnected installations in the response

repositoryCount.description: Number of repositories accessible to this installation

delete.description: Permanently deletes a GitHub App installation from the tenant. This hard deletes the installation record, all associated repositories, and project repository access entries. This action cannot be undone. Use POST /disconnect for soft delete instead. Note: This does NOT uninstall the GitHub App from GitHub - the user can do that separately from GitHub settings.
delete.summary: Delete a GitHub App installation permanently

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific GitHub App installation, including the full list of repositories.

post.description: Disconnects a GitHub App installation from the tenant. This soft deletes the installation (sets status to "disconnected") and removes all project repository access entries. The installation record is preserved for audit purposes. Note: This does NOT uninstall the GitHub App from GitHub - the user can do that separately from GitHub settings.

Reconnects a previously disconnected GitHub App installation by setting its status back to "active" and syncing the available repositories from GitHub. This can only be used on installations with "disconnected" status.

syncResult.description: Repository sync results (if sync was performed)

detail.example: Failed to connect to GitHub API

503.description: Service Unavailable - GitHub API is not accessible

post.summary: Reconnect a disconnected GitHub App installation

post.description: Manually refreshes the repository list for a GitHub App installation by fetching the current list from GitHub API. This is useful if webhooks were missed or to ensure the local data is in sync with GitHub.

detail.example: Failed to connect to GitHub API

503.description: Service Unavailable - GitHub API is not accessible

post.summary: Sync repositories for a GitHub App installation

post.description: Generates a short-lived API key (1 hour expiry) for authenticated users to access the run-api from the playground

apiKey.description: Temporary API key for playground use

expiresAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the key expires

post.summary: Generate temporary API key for playground

delete.description: Delete a complete project and cascade to all related entities (Agents, Sub Agents, tools, relationships)

409.description: Cannot delete project with existing resources

get.description: Returns the current GitHub repository access configuration for a project. If mode is "all", the project has access to all repositories from tenant GitHub installations. If mode is "selected", the project is scoped to specific repositories.

schema.description: GitHub access configuration for a project

mode.description: Access mode: "all" means project has access to all tenant repositories, "selected" means project is scoped to specific repositories

put.description: Configures which GitHub repositories a project can access. When mode is "all", the project has access to all repositories from tenant GitHub installations. When mode is "selected", the project is scoped to specific repositories (repositoryIds required). This replaces any existing access configuration.

mode.description: Access mode: "all" means project has access to all tenant repositories, "selected" means project is scoped to specific repositories
Access mode: "all" means project has access to all tenant repositories, "selected" means project is scoped to specific repositories

repositoryCount.description: Number of repositories the project now has access to (0 when mode="all")

get.description: Get a list of available prebuilt MCP servers. If COMPOSIO_API_KEY is configured, also includes Composio servers for the tenant/project.
List all users with explicit project access. Requires authz to be enabled.

post.description: Add a user to a project with a specified role. Requires authz to be enabled.

delete.description: Remove a user from a project. Requires authz to be enabled. Pass role as query param to specify which role to revoke.

patch.description: Update a project member's role. Requires authz to be enabled. Include previousRole to specify which role to revoke.

get.description: Get the current user's permissions for a project. Returns which actions the user can perform.

200.description: Project permissions for the current user

get.description: Resolve a ref string (branch name, tag name, or commit hash) to its full resolved ref with type and commit hash. Pass the ref as a query parameter.

post.description: Fetch details for a specific third-party MCP server (e.g., Composio) including authentication status and connect URL

url.description: The MCP server URL to fetch details for

post.description: Get the OAuth redirect URL for a third-party MCP server. Call this after scope selection to get the correct URL for the selected scope.

parameters.description: Skip MCP server discovery for faster response. Status will be "unknown".
parameters.name: skipDiscovery

schema.description: Skip MCP server discovery for faster response. Status will be "unknown".

get.description: Returns the current GitHub repository access configuration for an MCP tool. If mode is "all", the tool has access to all repositories the project can access. If mode is "selected", the tool is scoped to specific repositories.

mode.description: Access mode: "all" means the MCP tool has access to all project repositories, "selected" means the tool is scoped to specific repositories

repositories.description: List of repositories the MCP tool has access to (only populated when mode="selected")

installationAccountLogin.description: The GitHub account login for the installation

get.summary: Get MCP tool GitHub repository access

put.description: Configures which GitHub repositories an MCP tool can access. When mode is "all", the tool has access to all repositories the project can access. When mode is "selected", the tool is scoped to specific repositories (repositoryIds required). This replaces any existing access configuration. This endpoint only works for GitHub workapp MCP tools (isWorkApp=true and URL contains /github).

mode.description: Access mode: "all" means the MCP tool has access to all project repositories, "selected" means the tool is scoped to specific repositories
Access mode: "all" means the MCP tool has access to all project repositories, "selected" means the tool is scoped to specific repositories

repositoryCount.description: Number of repositories the MCP tool now has access to (0 when mode="all")

put.summary: Set MCP tool GitHub repository access

get.description: List all projects a user has explicit access to and their role in each. Requires authz to be enabled.

200.description: List of project memberships for the user

get.description: Check if the service is ready to serve traffic by verifying database connectivity

200.description: Service is ready - all health checks passed

503.description: Service is not ready - one or more health checks failed

post.description: Chat completion endpoint streaming with Vercel data stream protocol.
Handle user approval/denial of tool execution requests during conversations

approved.description: Whether the tool execution is approved

toolCallId.description: The tool call ID to respond to

400.description: Bad request - invalid tool call ID or conversation ID

404.description: Tool call not found or already processed

post.description: Webhook endpoint for third-party services to invoke an agent via a configured trigger
Creates a new chat completion with streaming SSE response using the configured agent

headers.description: Headers data for template processing (validated against context config schema)

name.description: The name of the message sender

model.description: The model to use for the completion

schema.description: Server-Sent Events stream with chat completion chunks

200.description: Streaming chat completion response in Server-Sent Events format

List Slack channels in the workspace that the bot can see
